data.content:
Tính từ
(từ Mỹ)
như cosy
xem cosy

adjective
US or Brit cosy cozier; -est
[also more ~; most ~]
small, comfortable, and warm
a cozy restaurant/cottage
The room was warm and cozy. - sometimes used in a joking or ironic way to describe a place that is not pleasant or comfortable
She glanced around the cramped apartment and said, Well, isn't this cozy?
friendly and pleasant
We had a cozy dinner with the whole family.
I spent a cozy evening reading in front of the fire.
a cozy chat
often disapproving :suggesting or showing a closeness between two people, groups, businesses, etc. :very close
He claims that there is a cozy arrangement/relationship between the police and the drug dealers. - often + with
His political opponents accuse him of getting/being too cozy with powerful companies.
noun
US or Brit cosy , pl -zies
[count] :a cloth cover that is placed over a teapot to keep the tea hot
a tea cozy
verb
US or Brit cosy -zies; -zied; -zying
cozy up
[phrasal verb] informal :to become or try to become friendly with someone in order to get help or some advantage - usually + to
He has been cozying up to the boss lately in hopes of getting a promotion.
